nodes.bodyText:
This is a laudable instinct, but I actually don't favor it. Reasons:

Prefer to separate test suites from when they may run
Runners often have fairly different infrastructures to spin up and potentially blow memory if accidentally run together
We want separate signals about what is unhealthy.

Regarding naming of a test suite "postcommit" I want to acknowledge that you are noticing how things are currently organized and following those conventions. So that's sensible. But it is a convention I think we have to move away from. Gradle can be run from lots of places and the notion of precommit vs postcommit is inessential.

nodes.bodyText: Noted below that coupling the various runners has some drawbacks. It is some boilerplate but can we factor it out into a few jobs: direct (candidate for precommit), flink (also candidate, but slower), dataflow (too slow for precommit).
